Data Centers

AI programs are housed in data centers. This is an example of what a data center looks like from the outside. This one is in Virginia.

Making Computations

Here, big computers work hard to make the computations that AI needs. This is a person standing between rows of these big computers.

Source: Runtime

Heating Up!

Because these computers are working so hard, they get HOT!

Have you ever noticed that your phone or computer can get hot? It’s like that, but hotter.

What's the Solution?

How do we stop the computers from getting too hot and breaking?

Cooling Down

Water helps keep the computers that run AI systems cool. It runs through cooling towers and pipes to keep the computers from overheating.

Stop & Think

How much water is used?

Please note: You must submit a guess to this question in order to count this activity as "complete" in the gradebook.

Display Answers

The Correct Answer

The amount of water actually varies depending on the area where the data center is located. On average, one 100-word email takes about a bottle of water. In some places like Washington state, it takes 3 bottles!

When you’re finished reflecting, continue reading to learn the answer!
